A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I have mixed thoughts on this one. As excited as I was too see it\, i left a bit underwhelmed. I liked some of the direction\, but to many questions & subplots.  Could have cut 30 min out and had a great movie. 

How is Rey operating so strong in the Force with virtually no training.  Did Luke teach her to levitate rocks?  What was the point of Canto Bight & Maz"s scene?  The cave? The rickety speeders on Crait supposed to threaten those walkers? When did Leia become Star-Lord?  The Force can keep you from freezing instantly in space? Humor felt forced at times. Phasma completely wasted. 

I liked the twists\, the battles were epic\, Rey/Kylo dynamic got interesting\, Adm. Holdo's decision\, big finale was cool\, return of old favorites. Visually it was stunning. 

As a big SW fan\, I generally enjoyed it\, can look past the shortcomings & will see again\, but not near the 2nd best in the series as some are saying. Somewhere in the middle.
